ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: So bear with the kafirun - bear with them for a while.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: So bear with unbelievers with patience, and give them respite for a while.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: So leave the unbelievers to themselves; respite them awhile.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Give respite to the disbelievers and leave them alone for a while.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Therefore give them some respite – give them some time.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: So, give a respite to the disbelievers; deal gently with them for a while.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: So grant the unbelievers a respite: let them alone for a while.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: So respite the unbelievers; delay with them awhile.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: So give a respite to the disbelievers. Deal thou gently with them for a while.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: so bear with those who deny the truth, and let them be for a little while.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: So respite thou the infidels - respite them gently,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: So respite the faithless; give them a gentle respite.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Therefore grant a delay to the Unbelievers: Give respite to them gently (for awhile).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: So give a respite to the disbelievers. Deal you gently with them for a while.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Therefore respite the unbelievers, and delay them for a while.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Therefore, give the blasphemers respite, a brief respite.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: So allow time for the disbelievers. Leave them awhile.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [86:17] So respite, O Muhammad (s), the disbelievers; grant them respite ([reiterated as] an emphasis, one enhanced by the use of a different form [mahhil, amhil]), that is to say, put them off, for a little (ruwaydā is a verbal noun emphasising the import of the operator, and is the diminutive form of rūd or irwad, with shortening of final consonant [ruwaydan, ruwaydā]). Surely enough God, exalted be He, seized them at Badr and abrogated [the dispensation of] ‘granting respite’ by the ‘sword’ verse, in other words, by the command to fight and struggle.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (So give a respite to the disbelievers. Deal thou gently with them for a while) give them a while until the Day of Badr'.
